name: Ruin
description: An elegant sword and crown disintegrate into eddies of ash. The Ruin card warns of the inevitability of decay and the danger of material attachments.

person.upright: A person who has renounced material attachments, such as a religious ascetic.
person.reverse: A person excessively attached to material goods (not necessarily excessive wealth).

creatureTrap.upright: A creature that destroys equipment, such as a rust monster or a black pudding.
creatureTrap.reverse: A Construct, especially an animated object.

place.upright: A ruin, or a retreat for ascetics.
place.reverse: A place meant to store goods, such as a warehouse or an armory.

treasure.upright: A treasure that is broken or in disrepair.
treasure.reverse: Valuable trade goods, well-made equipment, or a deed to property.

situation.upright: A situation involving the decay of objects or relationships over a long period of time.
situation.reverse: A situation involving the production or transportation of goods for sale.
